definition[0]: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer
example[0]: The company has consolidated its position as the countryâ€™s leading gas supplier.
example[1]: The team consolidated their lead with a third goal.
definition[1]: to combine things in order to make them more effective or easier to deal with
example[2]: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
example[3]: They took out a loan to consolidate their debts.
example[4]: The company is planning to consolidate its business activities at a new site in Arizona.
definition[2]: to make your position of power or success stronger and more likely to continue
example[5]: His successful negotiations with the Americans helped him to consolidate his position.
example[6]: The company has consolidated its hold on the European market.
definition[3]: to join together a group of companies, organizations, departments etc or to become joined together
example[7]: The corporation says it has been able to consolidate a number of operations and 1,100 jobs worldwide must go.
example[8]: He remains convinced that the smaller oil and gas companies should consolidate to add value for shareholders.
